stimulusHtml: The data in the graph best illustrate which of the following common criticisms of the electoral college?

features.html:
Number of Residents per Electoral Vote

Source: United States Census Bureau, 2010

choicesHtml: Small states have fewer electoral votes than large states and therefore have no impact on presidential elections.
Individuals in small-population states have a greater impact on the electoral college than individuals in large-population states.
Candidates from states with a large number of electoral votes have a major advantage in the electoral college.
Smaller states have more electoral votes than larger states, which distorts the popular vote.
